author: Staff Reporter
text:
Gurgaon gangster Sandeep Gadoli was killed in an encounter here on Sunday.

Gadoli, who has 36 cases registered against him, was carrying a reward of Rs 1.25 lakh on his head. “The firing was reported around 11 a.m. on Sunday in the MIDC police station area. A team of crime branch police of Gurgaon had come in search of the accused in a murder case, who was residing in a hotel in Andheri East. When the police team entered his room there was exchange of fire between the accused and the police team,” said Vinayak Deshmukh, Deputy Commissioner of Police, Zone X.

Two policemen were injured in the firing. Gadoli was seriously injured and was admitted to the public hospital, where he was declared dead at 12.55 p.m.

The two injured policemen were being treated at a hospital.

According to the Gurgaon police, Gadoli had 36 serious offences ranging from murder, attempt-to- murder and extortion registered against him. He was notorious for running an extortion racket targeting businessmen.

Sandeep was carrying a reward of

Rs 1.25 lakh on his head
title: Wanted Gurgaon gangster killed in encounter at Mumbai hotel
